result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R. Fowler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose except as approved by agent.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.

No drug paraphernalia.

Subject to random drug testing.

Comply with any conditions, no contacts and assessments per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
